citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: United States Cities and Towns, 2008

serinfo.issue: 2008 World, Europe, United States, Canada, and Mexico

descript.abstract:
United States Cities and Towns is a point theme representing cities and towns in the United States. Attribute information includes the name of the city and it's 2000 and 2007 populations.
This dataset is a part of the 2008 ESRI Data & Maps collection.
descript.purpose: United States Cities and Towns provides information about the locations, names, and populations of cities and towns for conducting geographic analysis on national and large regional scales.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:2,000,000.

cntinfo.cntinst:
In the United States: Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local ESRI Regional Office. For support, you may contact ESRI Support Center by telephone (voice) between 6:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; ESRI holidays excluded.
Outside the United States Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local ESRI International Distributor. This information can be found at http://gis.esri.com/intldist/contact/.
For other questions or comments, you may contact ESRI headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.2.4.1420

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using either ESRI SDC Data Development Kit Professional 2 (DDKP2) or tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then loaded into ArcSDE to verify and validate the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.

horizpa.horizpar: The geospatial part of this data set was originally extracted from the USGS 1:2,000,000-scale Digital Line Graphs (DLG) - Manmade Features. The horizontal positional accuracy is about 2 kilometers.

citeinfo.origin: National Atlas of the United States and the U.S. Geological Survey
citeinfo.title: Cities and Towns of the United States, 2008

procstep.procdesc:
Updates
1990 and 1998 population figures for Newtown, Connecticut were updated. County and county FIPS fields for the town of Bloomfield, CO were updated and it was listed as the county seat for Bloomfield County. County seats were added for counties where they were missing. Please note that Shannon County, SD; Todd County, SD; Kings, NY; Bronx, NY; Queens, NY; and Richmond, NY do not have official county seats.
Incorporated place names were compared with those from the 2004 GNIS database. GNIS names were used where there were discrepancies. New incorporated places were added; duplicate points and places no longer incorporated were removed. Positions of all incorporated places were adjusted to match GNIS coordinates. Minor positional corrections of incorporated places were made using 1999 Hydrography Features of the United States and 1999 County Boundaries of the United States as references. The population range values were adjusted to reflect 2000 population figures and the POP_2000 attribute was added; earlier population figures were dropped.

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Downloaded the compressed file from the National Atlas of the United States and extracted it. Removed unneeded attributes. Added the STATUS attribute and populated it with the text removed from the FEATURE attribute for all records where FEATURE was not "Populated Place". For the records where FEATURE was "Populated Place", attribute STATUS remains blank. Removed attribute FEATURE. Renamed attributes FIPS55 to PLACE_FIPS, STATE to ST_ABBREV, and POP_RANGE to FEATURE. Renamed values of the new FEATURE attribute from "Undetermined" or "0 - 9,999" to "less than 10,000". Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
The following steps were performed by ESRI: For records where POP_2000 has values of -99999 changed the values of FEATURE from "less than 10,000" to "no data".

The following steps were performed by ESRI: Added the POP2007 attribute and populated it with values from ESRI Community Data. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
